intro: Hieracium benhopense, commonly known as the Benhop hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium benhopense is often considered a weed due to its ability to spread rapidly in various habitats.
